ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: There was occasional asynchronous activities such as making and posting videos of ourselves speaking Italian.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: An introductory course covering basic nouns, adjectives, verb tenses (presente, passato prossimo, imperfetto, and trapassato prossimo), etc. While much of the focus seemed to be on grammar and writing, there were also opportunities to develop speaking skills.
Learned basic Italian and their culture.
Basic Italian vocabulary and grammar structures, as well as knowledge of Italian culture and customs

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: Giacomo Berchi is an amazing instructor. He understands the needs of the students and how to approach our difficulties in various different ways. Learning Italian was never stressful and always fun in this class.
Weaknesses: I wish there was more engagement with Italian culture, especially the arts. Beyond textbook readings, the occasional music video, and one film, there was limited engagement with Italy's rich cultural history.
Weakness is that this class goes extremely fast that it becomes hard to keep up.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Overall, the Zoom experience was good. There were very few interruptions and the instructor was understanding of the technical and academic difficulties posed by this new learning experience.
The practices were fairly standard and worked fairly well.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would highly recommend this course to another student. This course was a fun introduction a new language. The course was very well designed to facilitate learning. Although this course required daily engagement with the course material, it was overall well balanced.
Yes, just keep in mind that this course requires a lot of time.
Yes! I think Italian is an awesome language and Giacomo was an excellent instructor.
